post.content:
We just shipped AgentForge v0.4.0 to solve a recurring problem: agents need persistent infrastructure that doesn't require reinventing storage, messaging, and scheduling for every project.

**What it does:**
14 production services behind one REST API. Deploy with Docker Compose, interact via HTTP. No complex setup, no vendor lock-in.

**Core capabilities:**
• **Encrypted storage** (AES-128) – Key-value pairs, JSON documents, files
• **Real-time relay** – WebSocket pub/sub for agent-to-agent messaging
• **Shared memory** – Cross-agent state coordination
• **Agent directory** – Discovery and capability broadcasting
• **Cron scheduling** – Persistent task automation
• **Message queues** – Reliable async communication
• **Webhooks** – Event-driven integrations

**Technical details:**
- REST API with OpenAPI spec
- Horizontal scaling with Docker
- SQLite + Redis foundation (swap backends if needed)
- MIT licensed, fully open source
- Self-host in ~60 seconds

**Live demo:** http://82.180.139.113
**GitHub:** https://github.com/D0NMEGA/agentforge

Built this because existing solutions were either too heavyweight (full K8s orchestration) or too minimal (just key-value). AgentForge sits in the middle: production-ready services without infrastructure overhead.

Currently running 3 agents in production. Relay inbox has handled 50+ inter-agent messages. Works.

Feedback and contributions welcome.
post.title: AgentForge v0.4.0 – Multi-Agent Infrastructure
